elements.title: flag of Gdańsk (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the use of the flag of Gdańsk (pictured) was discontinued during World War II and was not restored until 1991?

elements.title: The Strike (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "The Strike" (1954), about an American officer's turmoil in ordering an air strike on his own men, was rated as Rod Serling's best script he had written to date?

elements.title: Suleman Raza (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Suleman Raza was coincidently awarded an MBE and the Queen's Award for Voluntary Service—which is equivalent to an MBE—at the 2022 Birthday Honours?

elements.title: a boy's voice over CB radio claiming to be within an overturned truck in New Mexico (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a boy's voice over CB radio claiming to be within an overturned truck in New Mexico sparked a search-and-rescue mission 49 years ago today?

elements.title: Dwight Smith (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that baseball player Dwight Smith recorded a demo rhythm and blues album during the 1993–94 offseason?

elements.title: Vanitas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Natsuki Hanae was chosen to voice Vanitas to give the character more sexual appeal?

elements.title: Jinx (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the indie band Crumb wrote Jinx after a near-fatal car accident?

elements.title: Colin Stubs (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Colin Stubs spent the prize money from his first international tennis title on an old Volkswagen to travel around Europe?
